intro: Calydorea alba, commonly known as the white calydorea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate white petals and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and thrives in cool climates. Its flowers bloom in late spring, producing a subtle fragrance that attracts pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
